abstract: Steve Jobs earned a place on Disney's board when he sold Pixar to the company in 2006. The deal also made him Disney's biggest shareholder.
snippet: Steve Jobs earned a place on Disney's board when he sold Pixar to the company in 2006. The deal also made him Disney's biggest shareholder.
lead_paragraph: Steve Jobs's death leaves an open seat on the board of the Walt Disney Company, which he joined in 2006 when he sold Pixar Animation Studio to Disney for $7.4 billion. The deal also made Mr. Jobs Disney's biggest shareholder. Although he frequently consulted with Robert A. Iger, Disney's chief executive, Mr. Jobs was not a frequent presence at board meetings, a fact that drew some criticism from people concerned with corporate governance.

headline.main: Jobs Frequently Consulted With Disney Chief
